issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: launch config object returns by boto contains either the ID or the name of the security group, which causes failure on the launch config landing page

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: The launch configs landing page takes 1-2 seconds *per item* to load due to a suboptimal approach to fetch the security groups for each launch config.
fields.summary: Launch configs landing page takes too long to load due to an excessive number of EC2 API calls

comments.body:
[~dkavanagh], [~kyolee], [~jloza]: Fix is at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/618

Would be great if we can test this prior to the next bug scrub, ideally on Euca and AWS.

[~dkavanagh], [~kyolee], [~jloza]: Discovered while working on this that a request with a malformed security group id (e.g. /securitygroups/asdf) would cause an unexpected redirect loop (with numerous errors output in the console log).  Fixed in pull request 618 by falling back to a name lookup if the id portion doesn't begin with "sg-"

Bottom line is, modifying the security group detail page lookup to allow names in the URL allowed us to significantly optimize the launch configs landing page *and* prevent the serious redirect loop issue.

[~kgill] So far I wasn't able to find any major issue with the branch GUI-822. 

The only issue that I saw was that when the security group name was created with "/" char, such as "new.security+group/01_02(03)", from the launch page landing page, trying to reach the security group's detail page would end up in the "404 Not Found" error due to the "/" in the URL issue.

[~kgill] Detected the redirect loop issue while testing on AWS. It turns out that after creating a launch config, then delete the security group that was specified in the created launch config, thus the security group no longer exists, and try to click the name of the security group on the launch config landing page, then the page errors out with the redirect loop failure.

You can this error on AWS N.Virgina region with the launch config "Alice-LC"'s security group.
[~kyolee] Did you observe the redirect loop on the develop branch or on the GUI-822 branch?

[~kyolee]: Fixed the redirect loop on AWS in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/7f229482fde9997c0955b722038a137ac0fc8c87

Also pushed a fix for an issue that prevented the security groups landing page from loading due to an errant vpc id filter.  [~kyolee]: Any idea why https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/7f229482fde9997c0955b722038a137ac0fc8c87#diff-98bb9ccdebf59ba51d585d1d8d0691daL108 was there?

[~kgill] Filter for the VPC ID was needed to hide the security groups that belong to VPC. Without the filter, we would end up with 3 or so default security groups, which breaks the dropdown selection on wizards.

[~kyolee] The line I referenced in the commit above is for the security groups landing page JSON, not for the wizards.  AFAICT, we don't need the vpc condition on the landing page.  In fact, the vpc condition prevents any security groups from displaying on the landing page in AWS.  What wizards are you referring to?

[~kgill] For the launch instance wizard and the launch config wizard, the security group dropdown menu will display 3 default groups. When selected one, since it picks up the name of the security group "default", it doesn't know which "default" group to use, ends up choosing the first appeared "default" group when submitted.

And, yes, the security group JSON for the landing page was needed to be filtered to remove the VPC security groups from displayed.

[~kyolee]: Hmm, I don't understand why we are not displaying VPC security groups on the landing page.  The JSON fetch for the landing page has nothing to do with the launch wizards.  If the confusion in the wizards is displaying multiple "default" security groups, there is a better way to fix that than removing all non-classic security groups from the app (e.g. display the security group name and id if they are distinct).  Preventing display of any VPC security groups essentially renders the AWS side of our console useless IMO.  

/cc [~jloza], [~kedwards]
[~kyolee], [~jloza], [~kedwards]: I have opened GUI-832 to address the VPC security groups issue.
we should definitely fix this bug for 4.0, it's bad.

created five LCs, page loaded within one second.

Verified on mac osx 10.9.2, FF 29.0
Just a heads up that if https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/2cca4377e00fdf3915d23c4e2c97337211c00aa5 is merged into develop, we may need to reopen this issue.
[~kgill] rather than reopen this issue, can we make sure this doesn't happen in the feature branch you are working on?
[~jloza]: [~kyolee] is working on that branch--just wanted to raise a red flag when I saw that commit.
